column4: it's weird as well, the desktop environment returned to classic environment without the icons on the side posteri the video card installation
have rebooted a few times trying to get the icons on the side back (Gnome 3.0 environment maybe), though without any fortune respectively
What card? Have you installed the latest proprietary drivers (form AMD/NV)?
it is the Geforce GT620 card, & have not installed any drivers yet for lack of knowing
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-x-swat/x-updates && sudo apt-get  update && sudo apt-get upgrade - it will give you the latest stable drivers from nVidia.
Of course you will have to reboot (not just restart X).
Only if you already have the nvidia-current package installed
fairly certain the recent nvidia drivers were not installed
help, the display is left of center, though aside from that, perfect!
Primarily the resolution and refresh rate. You must use "Save to X configuration file" to save them permanently.
how to save them to X configuration file?
There's a button for it, whrere you change the resolution and refresh rate.
yes, gracias. Just making certain since it gave a "browse" option
You might want to run "sudo nvidia-xconfig" prior to doing any changes in the panel (you must disable X to do it).
